name: NPR
text:
Police have arrested and charged a 31-year-old man over a shooting during an attempt by protesters to topple a conquistador statue in New Mexico.

The suspect is a one-time candidate for city council and son of a former sheriff.
https://t.co/KKHrQtkIVU

name: NPR
text:
Archaeologists have found the skeleton of a baby with Down syndrome who died nearly 4,000 years ago ‚Äî the oldest confirmed case of Down syndrome.
https://t.co/OEmh82Emxa

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Tim Scott gave an emotional speech on the 5-year anniversary of the shooting at Emanuel AME Church ‚Äî and lambasted a Democratic colleague for referring to his police reform bill as "token" legislation.
https://t.co/zFJccf7KsE

name: NPR
text:
The Justice Department has filed a motion for an emergency restraining order against John Bolton to block the publication of his explosive new memoir ‚Äî the latest escalation in the legal battle over the book.
https://t.co/tdxLiaLP6z

name: NPR
text:
When slavery ended, the disenfranchisement of African Americans did not ‚Äî discrimination continued in jobs, housing and education. 

Economist William Darity Jr. offers a roadmap on how to implement reparations to close the racial wealth gap.
https://t.co/AhecjYQhAl

name: NPR
text:
The Atlanta police officer who shot and killed Rayshard Brooks was involved in another controversial police shooting in 2015 ‚Äî a case that a local judge found so troubling, she's still bothered by it to this day. (@apmreports)
https://t.co/L4jYMRSC6N

name: NPR
text:
While it's still unclear when Major League Baseball will play a 2020 season, Dr. Anthony Fauci recommends the league finish its postseason before October to avoid playing games amid both a pandemic and flu season.
https://t.co/Pwb0WYR4Qv

name: NPR
text:
The pandemic has often been treated as a political issue, but epidemiologist Michael Osterholm says that the risks supersede partisanship. 

"Eventually there won't be any blue states or red states," he says. "It'll all be COVID colored." 
https://t.co/djnlGB13ZA

name: NPR
text: RT @nprmusic: üè† Quarantined in their own homes, Este, Danielle and Alana Haim each recorded their own part for this Tiny Desk (home) concert. Watch @HAIMtheband perform 3 tracks ‚Äì together, separately ‚Äì from 'Women in Music Pt. III.' https://t.co/5c3ElY7L0r

name: NPR
text:
Here's what scientists know about asymptomatic spread ‚Äî and what might have caused the World Health Organization's mixed messages about it. üëá
https://t.co/vY3Xyt2QBg

name: NPR
text:
Skip Auld was named Hampton ‚Äî for his great-grandfather, whose namesake was Wade Hampton III.

Four generations of Auld men shared the name ‚Äî until last year, when Auld learned more about Hampton's racist life and ‚Äúterrorist campaign.‚Äù
https://t.co/qaFjJ6NmrO

name: NPR
text:
Women's music is a genre carried by artists who, in their own way, are constantly bucking against the patriarchy ‚Äî whether singing about non-heteronormative love or injustice.
https://t.co/eVhFFN5kei

name: NPR
text:
CBS soap opera "The Bold and The Beautiful" resumed taping Wednesday ‚Äî the first scripted series to resume work on set.

"I think we can do lots with the smoldering look and the slow burn," one actress says about taping love scenes.
https://t.co/8icwG2xi3y

name: NPR
text:
Experts say there is a catharsis in watching someone struggle with feelings you are having.

In this difficult time, television has emerged as a surprising resource, with important examples of how people process grief.
https://t.co/9SPMU4WlSR

name: NPR
text: In heavy metal, Rita Indiana found the music "to be very descriptive of the horrors that we've lived in the Dominican Republic under dictatorships, [slavery] ‚Äì our history is a horrorosa." https://t.co/YzuQaXb75H

name: NPR
text:
An all-white jury. 
A black man accused of terrorism. 
The evidence? 
Rap lyrics. 

This week on @HiddenBrain, how prosecutors use the genre for their arguments that a defendant is violent. https://t.co/hCnf8LNDny

name: NPR
text: The country's oldest black theater company is staging a streaming Juneteenth special that will connect the historic observance into the current moment.  @WCPN https://t.co/9RxRJvYqkY

name: NPR
text:
Nooses found at a public park in Oakland will be removed and investigated as hate crimes, Mayor Libby Schaaf says. The announcement comes after the hanging deaths of two Black men in Southern California.
https://t.co/WYjBz4jgNn

name: NPR
text:
NPR surveyed all 50 states to find out how many people they have doing contact tracing.

Given current case counts, only 7 states and D.C. are staffed to the level researchers say is necessary to contain outbreaks.
https://t.co/BhfQAPRqkU

name: NPR
text:
President Trump told Chinese President Xi Jinping that he endorsed Beijing's now-infamous archipelago of prison camps for minority Uighurs, John Bolton writes in his new memoir.
 https://t.co/HbUm4OPvQX

name: NPR
text:
Michael Pack‚ÄîTrump's pick to lead the U.S. Agency for Global Media‚Äîshowed up to work for the first time and swiftly sidelined most of the agency's senior leadership.

Two people tell NPR he gave no reason for his actions other than his authority to do so.
https://t.co/bwmIRoWmsx

name: NPR
text:
Chase Purdy's briskly paced and bold new book explores the meaning of meat, its future and those at the forefront of developing cell-cultured meat.
https://t.co/DBwqiulQiw

name: NPR
text:
Secretary of State Mike Pompeo met China's top diplomat Yang Jiechi in Hawaii on Wednesday. Neither country publicly announced the meeting in advance, and it's unclear which side proposed it.
https://t.co/ndGiFhAUST

name: NPR
text: Language barring non-white people from owning or living on a property was woven into tens of thousands of deeds in Minneapolis ‚Äî carving inequity directly into its map and setting the stage for one of the biggest racial wealth gaps of any major U.S. city. https://t.co/MWWsUTqG68 https://t.co/ldVbvbWDTO

name: NPR
text: The Supreme Court has ruled against the Trump administration and extended a lifeline to DACA ‚Äî allowing the program‚Ä¶ https://t.co/MSadDxTgn3

text: An NPR survey of state health departments shows that the national coronavirus contact-tracing workforce has tripled‚Ä¶ https://t.co/SXnzVl0jZM

text: Former Atlanta police officer Garrett Rolfe faces felony murder and 10 other charges in the shooting of Rayshard Br‚Ä¶ https://t.co/MB5YJDEXsq
